trans-unit.source: Manages all the input systems in Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF).
The <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager> class is responsible for coordinating all of the input systems in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)].
A filter is any code that listens to <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PreProcessInput> or <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PostProcessInput>.
Filters can modify the input staging area.
A monitor is any code that listens to <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PreNotifyInput> or <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PostNotifyInput>.
Monitors cannot modify the input staging area.
The <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager> controls the input staging area.
The input staging area processes input into [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] events.
Input is processed in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] in the follow stages:
Pre-process stage.
The input manager raises the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PreProcessInput> event.
Pre-notify stage.
The input manager raises the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PreNotifyInput> event.
The [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] input event or events are raised.
Post-notify stage.
The input manager raises the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PostNotifyInput> event.
Post-process stage.
The input manager raises the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PostProcessInput> event.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.InputManager"></xref> associated with the current thread.
This class will not be available in Internet zone.
The input manager.
Occurs when a control enters menu mode by calling the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PushMenuMode(System.Windows.PresentationSource)"></xref> method.
Components register delegates with this event to respond to a control entering the input manager’s menu mode.
Occurs when the result of a hit-test may have changed.
Gets a collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Input.InputManager.InputProviders"></xref> registered with the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.InputManager"></xref>.
The collection of input provides.
Gets a value that indicates whether this <xref href="System.Windows.Interop.ComponentDispatcher"></xref> is in menu mode.
The <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.IsInMenuMode%2A> property returns `true` if any menus are open, and it returns `false` if no menus are open.
`true` if this <xref href="System.Windows.Interop.ComponentDispatcher"></xref> is in menu mode; otherwise, `false`.
Occurs when a control leaves menu mode by calling the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PopMenuMode(System.Windows.PresentationSource)"></xref> method.
Components register delegates with this event to respond to a control leaving the input manager’s menu mode.
Gets a value that represents the input device associated with the most recent input event.
The input device.
Called by components to leave menu mode.
A component calls this method to leave the input manager’s menu mode.
The `menuSite` releases privileged access to window messages.
Calling this method causes the internal count of open menus to decrement and sets the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.IsInMenuMode%2A> property to `false`, if this is the last menu to close.
The menu to leave.
menuSite is `null`.

Occurs after the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PreNotifyInput"></xref> handlers have finished processing the input and the corresponding [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] events have been raised.
A monitor is any code that listens to <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PreNotifyInput> or <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PostNotifyInput>.
Monitors cannot modify the input staging area.
The handlers attached to <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PostNotifyInput> are invoked in reverse order so that handlers added by the users are invoked before handlers in the system.
Input is processed in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] in the follow stages:
Pre-process stage.
The input manager raises the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PreProcessInput> event.
Pre-notify stage.
The input manager raises the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PreNotifyInput> event.
The [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] input event or events are raised.
Post-notify stage.
The input manager raises the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PostNotifyInput> event.
Post-process stage.
The input manager raises the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PostProcessInput> event.
Occurs after the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PreNotifyInput"></xref> handlers have finished processing the input.
A filter is any code that listens to <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PreProcessInput> or <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PostProcessInput>.
Filters can modify the input staging area.
The handlers attached to <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PostProcessInput> are invoked in reverse order so that handlers added by the users are invoked before handlers in the system.
Input is processed in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] in the follow stages:
Pre-process stage.
The input manager raises the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PreProcessInput> event.
Pre-notify stage.
The input manager raises the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PreNotifyInput> event.
The [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] input event or events are raised.
Post-notify stage.
The input manager raises the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PostNotifyInput> event.
Post-process stage.
The input manager raises the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PostProcessInput> event.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PreProcessInput"></xref> handlers have finished processing the input, if the input was not canceled.
A monitor is any code that listens to <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PreNotifyInput> or <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PostNotifyInput>.
Monitors cannot modify the input staging area.
The handlers attached to <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PreNotifyInput> are invoked in reverse order so that handlers added by the users are invoked before handlers in the system.
Input is processed in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] in the follow stages:
Pre-process stage.
The input manager raises the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PreProcessInput> event.
Pre-notify stage.
The input manager raises the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PreNotifyInput> event.
The [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] input event or events are raised.
Post-notify stage.
The input manager raises the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PostNotifyInput> event.
Post-process stage.
The input manager raises the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PostProcessInput> event.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.InputManager"></xref> starts to process the input item.
A filter is any code that listens to <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PreProcessInput> or <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PostProcessInput>.
Filters can modify the input staging area.
The handlers attached to <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PreProcessInput> are invoked in reverse order so that handlers added by the users are invoked before handlers in the system.

Calling <xref:System.Windows.Input.PreProcessInputEventArgs.Cancel%2A> on the <xref:System.Windows.Input.PreProcessInputEventArgs> passed to the <xref:System.Windows.Input.PreProcessInputEventHandler> will cancel the processing of the input.
Input is processed in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] in the follow stages:
Pre-process stage.
The input manager raises the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PreProcessInput> event.
Pre-notify stage.
The input manager raises the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PreNotifyInput> event.
The [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] input event or events are raised.
Post-notify stage.
The input manager raises the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PostNotifyInput> event.
Post-process stage.
The input manager raises the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PostProcessInput> event.
Gets the primary keyboard device.
The keyboard device.
Gets the primary mouse device.
The mouse device.
Processes the specified input synchronously.
A filter is any code that listens to <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PreProcessInput> or <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PostProcessInput>.
Filters can modify the input staging area.
A monitor is any code that listens to <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PreNotifyInput> or <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PostNotifyInput>.
Monitors cannot modify the input staging area.
The specified input is processed by all the filters and monitors and is finally dispatched to the appropriate element as an input event.
Input is processed in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] in the follow stages:
Pre-process stage.
The input manager raises the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PreProcessInput> event.
Pre-notify stage.
The input manager raises the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PreNotifyInput> event.
The [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] input event or events are raised.
Post-notify stage.
The input manager raises the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PostNotifyInput> event.
Post-process stage.
The input manager raises the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.PostProcessInput> event.
The input to process.
`true` if all input events were handled; otherwise, `false`.
input is `null`.
Called by components to enter menu mode.
A component calls this method to enter the input manager’s menu mode.
The `menuSite` gets privileged access to window messages.
Calling this method causes the internal count of open menus to increment and sets the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputManager.IsInMenuMode%2A> property to `true`, if this is the first menu to open.
The menu to enter.
menuSite is `null`.
